ALBATROSS
  • ALBATROSS.axial
  • View page source

ALBATROSS.axial

Contains the most important classes for beam formulations using shear-deformable Timoshenko Beam Theory

Module Contents

Classes

Axial

Timoshenko shear deformable beam formulation

BeamAxis

class ALBATROSS.axial.Axial(domain, xsinfo, orientation)

Timoshenko shear deformable beam formulation

Inputs:

domain: 1D analysis mesh beam_props: 2-tensor (6x6) function defining beam properties along span

_construct_system()
_get_dofs(pt, dof_type='disp')
_solve_simple()
add_clamped_point(pt)

pt = x,y,z location of clamped point

add_clamped_point_topo(dof)
add_dist_load(f)

f = tuple for (x,y,z) components of distributed load

add_point_load(f_list, pts)

f = list of tuples for (x,y,z) components of point force force pts : list of (x,y,z) location along beam axis to apply point force

add_point_moment(m_list, pts)

f = list of tuples for (x,y,z) components of point force force pts : list of (x,y,z) location along beam axis to apply point force

compute_local_axes()
elastic_energy()
generalized_strains(w)
generalized_stresses(w)
get_deformed_basis(points)
get the transformation matrix from the reference beam frame (b) to the

deformed beam frame (B)

This only works under the assumption of small displacments (e.g. linear beam theory)

get_global_disp(points)

returns the displacement and rotation at a specific point on the beam axis with respect to the global coordinate system

ARGS:

points = list of (x,y,z) locations to return displacements and rotations

RETURNS:

list of [disp,rotations], where disp and rot are both shape (numpts,3)

get_local_basis(points)

returns the basis vectors for a set of points given as a (numpts,3,3) ndarray

get_local_disp(points)

returns the displacement and rotation at a specific point on the beam axis with respect to the axial direction and xs principle axes

ARGS:

point = tuple of (x,y,z) locations to return displacements and rotations

RETURNS:

ndarray of 3x2 of [disp,rotations], where disp and rot are both shape 3x1

get_reactions(points)
returns a list of forces and moments at the specified

beam axis location

plot_axial_displacement(warp_factor=1)

returns a fxn defined over a 3D mesh generated from the 2D xs’s and the 1D analysis mesh

solve()
span_to_xyz(l)
tangent(domain)
tgrad(w)
xyz_to_span(pt)
